name: The Martin Lewis Money Show
overview: Consumer champion Martin Lewis gives viewers money-saving tips.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: In the first of a new series Martin Lewis brings his money-saving tips to ITV.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: The financial journalist presents money-saving tips to help consumers cope with the current economic climate, offering expert advice on everything from premium bonds, student loans and tax credits to supermarket loyalty schemes and high-street shopping.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Martin heads to the Ford Dagenham car plant to advise workers on boosting their savings. Saira Khan learns how to haggle in stores - and how to challenge unfair parking tickets.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: The financial journalist visits hospital workers in Manchester to explain how to claim back mis-sold payment protection insurance, and takes to the stage for a rant about spam texts. Saira Khan hits the racing track to learn how to drive and save money at the same time.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: The financial journalist presents his guide to coping with the current economic climate, offering tips on how to turn shopping loyalty points into trips abroad and investigating premium bonds. Saira Khan finds out if she can make a profit buying goods from car-boot sales and selling them on auction sites.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: The financial journalist and reporter Saira Khan climb aboard the naval frigate HMS Westminster to throw the crew a Christmas party on a budget. Plus, an experiment to test the theory that small children prefer wrapping paper to the presents inside.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: New series. The financial guru and reporter Saira Khan return with more money-saving tips to help consumers cope with the current economic climate. They begin in Ripon, North Yorkshire, showing people how they can claim council tax rebates worth thousands of pounds by having their homes rebanded.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: The financial guru is joined by reporter Saira Khan in Manchester to offer advice on finding and stopping hidden, wasted payments which can cost thousands of pounds. Plus, tips on how to deal with tax changes in April.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: The personal-finance guru is joined by Saira Khan in Spain for an edition focusing on saving holiday-makers' money while they're abroad.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: New series. Financial guru Martin Lewis and reporter Saira Khan return to help viewers get the most from their money in 2014. In this edition they tackle post-Christmas financial blues with practical tips on how to deal with debt, cut monthly outgoings and stay in the black for good.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis and Saira Khan present a comprehensive guide to energy tariffs, offering no-nonsense analysis of the marketplace and providing workers at a cereal factory in Northamptonshire with advice on switching friends and relatives to the options that are most suitable for them.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: The financial journalist advises shoppers in Southampton on how to get compensation for delayed flights, and takes to the streets in a motorhome to get across his message on cheaper car and home insurance. Plus, Saira Khan offers tips on cutting costs without making lifestyle changes.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis and Saira Khan turn their attention to property. With the launch of the Government's Help to Buy scheme and interest rate rises predicted, Martin provides tips for first-time homeowners and those wishing to remortgage, revealing how to find the best deals and save money.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis and Saira Khan take to the streets in a motorhome to provide advice on cheaper car and home insurance. Plus, the latest tips on balance transfers, student loans and cutting costs without changing lifestyle.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis and Saira Khan make some huge savings by haggling down prices on package holidays, and reveal how to get a good deal on hire cars abroad. The reclaim store also returns as Martin demonstrates how to get back payment-protection insurance for free. Last in the series.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: New series. The personal finance guru returns with money-saving tips and tricks just in time for the festive season. The series kicks off on Black Friday with a look at not-to-be-missed deals, and the Festive Forecaster, predicting the start dates for high-street flash sales over the coming weeks. In Hertfordshire, Martin and reporter Saira Khan help a family carry out a personal stock-take of all their belongings to help raise money for Christmas, selling off old clothes, mobile phones, buggies and toys. There's also a visit to the Christmas Ideal Home Show with ideas on how to conjure up cash for the holidays.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: The personal finance guru helps customers take on the energy giants, revealing that 3.5 million people are owed a collective £200million from their old suppliers, and explains how to get that money back with just one phone call. The Festive Forecaster predicts the date to look for deals and discount codes in December, and Martin shows how it's possible to buy high-street fashion abroad and take a budget flight back to the UK and still make a saving.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: The personal finance guru investigates the rules surrounding train fares with help from reporter Saira Khan, and reveals a raft of perfectly legitimate tricks to save cash on festive travel, as well as season tickets in the new year. The prudent pair also continue their countdown to a cheaper Christmas with the final update of the Festive Forecaster.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Solving cash conundrums around the UK, Martin Lewis and Saira Khan set off on the first of their money roadshows. The personal finance guru meets a mother who has been secretly saving for her children all their lives, but now they are coming of age, can she trust them not to blow their windfall? Plus, tips and tricks to help cut costs going into the new year.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: The personal finance guru continues his journey around the UK with Saira Khan, solving the public's cash conundrums. The duo meet consumers who are tackling their energy suppliers over poor service, explain how to fight back, and reveal the best deals.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: As bills for the big spends of Christmas start to drop through letter boxes across the country, the financial journalist and his co-presenter Saira Khan explain how to maximise credit to cut the cost of existing debt to help ease New Year financial hangovers.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: The personal finance guru continues his money roadshow with Saira Khan, solving the public's cash conundrums. Tonight, they tackle the awkward matter of managing family finances when a close relative loses mental capacity, and how to claim compensation from airlines for delayed flights without paying a middleman.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: The personal finance expert helps viewers in Manchester decide if they should use their savings to pay off their mortgage, and in a guide to haggling techniques, he and co-presenter Saira Khan explain how a single call could save many people hundreds of pounds on the cost of broadband, home phone and breakdown cover.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: The financial guru and reporter Saira Khan meet a couple with very different views on their money, and help them work together to reach the best outcome. The prudent pair also present a guide to cutting the price of holidays, from slashing the cost of booking to saving money on reaching foreign soil. Last in the series.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: New series. The personal finance guru returns with money-saving tips and tricks just in time for the festive season, beginning with a look at not-to-be-missed Black Friday deals. The Festive Forecaster also reappears, predicting the start dates for high-street flash sales over the coming weeks, and Martin and reporter Saira Khan present a run down on how switching bank accounts could lead to bonuses of hundreds of pounds.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: The financial expert and Saira Khan have more of the latest Christmas shopping deals, as well as news on help for first-time buyers trying to get a leg-up onto the property ladder, including how adding a bit extra to a deposit could save thousands of pounds in the long run.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: The financial expert and reporter Saira Khan have details on how to get the cheapest EasyJet flights for next year, while Martin explains how simple it is to save hundreds of pounds when switching energy supplier. Plus, important news on how to keep savings safe when protections levels are reduced in January.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: New series. The financial journalist returns with an hour-long special set in front of an audience at a London dockside warehouse. He attempts to save consumers money on their energy bills, and with the help of co-presenters Saira Khan and Ranvir Singh, viewers will also be invited to get in touch via social media and email during the show to talk about their own switching stories. Plus, predictions for the upcoming Black Friday discounts

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis and Saira Khan look at various ways to save money. In this show, they offer tips on how to get the most out of your savings in the wake of interest rate cuts.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: The financial journalist is joined by Saira Khan to present money-saving tips to help consumers cope with the current economic climate, offering expert advice on everything from premium bonds, student loans and tax credits to supermarket loyalty schemes and high-street shopping.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Finance show presented by Martin Lewis and Saira Khan. In this programme, Martin and Saira reveal how to book a fantastic summer holiday at a great price, as well as rounding up the latest on cheap foreign currency, travel insurance and flights.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis and Saira Khan offer more money saving tips. In the final show of the series, Martin and Saira have new information on lifetime ISAs and tips on how a credit card can act as a guarantee. Plus they offer more out-of-this-world savings advice.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Consumer champion Martin Lewis asks why 60 per cent of the nation have never switched energy providers - they are more than likely to be overpaying on their gas and electricity bills. With winter on the way and prices rising, household energy bills are only going up. Martin and Angellica Bell explain how easy it is switch provider and save money.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: The financial journalist and co-host Angellica Bell present a January `bill busting' special, answering viewers' questions live and revealing the best phone, broadband, bank account, breakdown cover and digital TV deals currently on the market.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis and Angellica Bell present a 'Credit Score Special'. If you are trying to get a credit card, mortgage or loan, you need to watch this show! Do you also want the benefit of all those store loyalty cards but without the weight of them around in your wallet? Fortunately for you, Martin has the perfect solution!

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Martin and Angellica explain the benefits of having a 'Lifetime ISA' or a 'Help to Buy ISA' in this edition of the  programme. We also find out how you can do all your weekly shopping for less than ú2!

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Over the past five years the financial journalist has been instrumental in the British public being able to reclaim millions back after being mis-sold payment protection insurance when taking out loans, credit cards or mortgages. In this edition, Martin reveals how people could still make a claim and be owed thousands despite not being mis-sold PPI in the first place.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: With parents, grandparents and students all being concerned about a being saddled with a lifetime of debt, the financial journalist and Angellica Bell present a special edition focusing on student loans, revealing how best to plan, manage and pay for them.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: This episode sees Martin answer the biggest question asked when the show is out and about on its roadshows - 'What should I do with my child's savings?' We'll also reveal how to get cheap life insurance, an out-of-this world method for deciphering those confusing supermarket deals, and a neat little trick to getting cheaper train travel.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: The financial journalist and Angellica Bell look at the issue of council tax, revealing if viewers could be paying too much, due a refund or entitled to a discount. Plus, they reveal how to go about getting compensation for delayed trains.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: The nation's favourite money guru Martin Lewis comes to the aid of a viewer when she asks where the best place to put £200,000 is. There is a fast food tip that could save you a small fortune, and who is responsible for the council tax in your house?

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: With the Government announcing an energy price cap, the financial journalist is on hand with an energy special. He explains exactly how this limit will work and how it is possible to save even more money on gas and electricity bills. Plus, a fast food tip that will put pounds not just pennies back in consumers' pockets

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: It has seldom been more difficult to get on the property ladder, so tonight the financial journalist is on hand to explain how it is possible for first-time buyers to still purchase a home. Plus, find out how to get hold of cheap theatre tickets and who in the household is responsible for council tax. Last in the series.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: After the big Christmas spend, the nation's favourite money guru is returning to explain the best ways of managing your debt...

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: The financial journalist offers advice on insurance, one the biggest household expenditures, revealing how to avoid sky-high charges for car, home or life cover. Plus, a look at the best options for those who receive a large lump sum.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: The financial journalist examines the hidden costs of going to university and reveals a quirk in the system that could affect the amount people get for their student loans - even after they have begun their courses. Plus, advice on claiming PPI before the deadline passes, and showing viewers how to make ensure they are not overpaying for holidays.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: The financial journalist explains the possibilities of making a small fortune as a `comper', with one viewer reporting winnings in excess of £70,000 by regularly entering competitions in newspapers, magazines and online. He also offers advice on equity release.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: The financial journalist answers the question he gets asked most as he offers advice on where people should put their savings in light of an improvement in interest rates. Plus, a look at consumers' rights if a former energy supplier sends out a big bill six months after they left them.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: The financial journalist reveals his five main tips about ways viewers could be claiming money back, including through the marriage tax allowance or the uniform tax relief. Plus, with the holiday season approaching, find out when is the best time to buy travel insurance.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: The financial journalist has been talking about PPI for over a decade and so far around £15bn has been reclaimed. With the final deadline set for this August, Martin offers advice as he tries to make sure no-one is left behind and missing out on their entitlement to mis-sold PPI. Plus, a look at the pros and cons of the workplace auto-enrolment pension scheme.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: The financial journalist and co-host Angellica Bell returns with more money-saving tips and advice, beginning with up-to-the-minute information on the impending deadline for the Help to Buy ISA scheme. Martin has also been travelling across the country answering the pressing financial concerns of the nation.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Britain is becoming a nation of switchers, with nearly six million people changing their service suppliers last year. The big six energy companies are now dropping prices - so the demand for better deals is increasing. In this edition devoted to the topic, Martin and Angellica Bell offer advice and reveal the best deals.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: With less than 10 per cent of consumers shopping around for a new broadband deal last year, the financial journalist explains how to avoid being one of the four million households who are being overcharged by their internet providers.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: It can get pretty tough in January with Christmas bills flooding through the nation's letterboxes, so the financial journalist and Angellica Bell are on hand to help navigate new regulations relating to overdrafts. Plus, there is a look at consumer rights when asking for a refund.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: As January, the toughest month for many people, continues, the financial journalist and Angellica Bell look at what solutions there might be for cutting mounting debts, including comparing the pros and cons of loans and credit cards.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: The financial journalist and Angellica Bell offer more advice to viewers, looking at whether people could be owed tax back on their PPI claims and comparing child savings accounts to find out which are the best bets.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: The financial journalist and Angellica Bell offer advice to viewers about how to get the best deals possible on car and home insurance policies, some of the biggest bills to hit people's pockets. Plus, are you part of one of the 1.3 million households entitled to claim pension credit?

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: The financial journalist and Angellica Bell offer advice to viewers about consumer rights when buying goods in store and online, and look at what the best mortgage rates are for people who are navigating the property market?

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Last year one in every 20 people was a victim of fraud - with scammers stealing millions from the British public doing it increasingly via the internet. The financial journalist and Angellica Bell look at potential solutions for people who have been caught out and the need for greater online controls.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: The financial expert returns, starting a new series with an extended 1 hour edition looking at financial education for children.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: The financial expert is joined by Angellica Bell for another round of advice on family finances, jobs and consumer rights, including the latest deals of the week and tips on making money go further.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Financial guru Martin Lewis continues to answer all your questions on family finances, jobs and consumer rights. There's also the latest News You Can Use.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: As the second lockdown continues, families face even more economic uncertainty than ever before. Martin is on hand to answer viewers' questions on how the crisis affects personal finance and consumer rights, he looks at the latest offers and has tips on making money go further. With Angellica Bell.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: As the nation prepares for a different kind of Christmas this year, Martin Lewis answers viewers' questions on how the ongoing crisis affects personal finance and consumer rights. He and Anjellica Bell also have the latest news and tips on making money go further over the coming month.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: With just two weeks to go until Christmas Day, Martin Lewis has tips on how to make money go further during this very different festive period. He and Anjellica Bell also have the latest financial news and Martin's Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: It's officially the final countdown to Christmas Day, and with just days to go, Martin Lewis shares his top money saving tips. He'll also be answering your questions on consumer rights and family budgets - and there's the latest News You Can Use and Martin's Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: Martin returns after the festive break with his January Bill Busting top tips. He'll be answering your questions on how our relationship with Europe could be impacting on family finances, and there's also the latest News You Can Use and Martin's Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: As January continues and the credit card bills continue to arrive, Martin Lewis is on hand to help the nation through tricky financial times. He also answers questions on consumer rights and savings rates, and there's the latest News You Can Use and Martin's Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: As the nation continues to work through its third national lockdown, Martin Lewis is on hand to share his top tips and advice, helping the nation through this current tricky financial situation. He'll also be answering your questions on the fourth Self Employed Income Support Scheme (SEISS) grant and furlough payments. Plus, there's the latest News You Can Use and Martin's Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Energy
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis and Angellica Bell are back with a brand new series of the nation's favourite money show, including how to avoid an energy price hike.

episodes.name: Broadband
episodes.overview: Following on from the energy crisis, Martin gives his tips on how to recoup the extra costs by switching broadband package. He's also on hand to tackle your fiscal questions.

episodes.name: Energy Revisit
episodes.overview: As the energy crisis continues for millions, Martin returns to answer all your burning questions, as well as give hints and tips on how to get the most out of your money.

episodes.name: Car & Home Insurance
episodes.overview: The cash guru continues to answer the financial questions that matter most. Alongside The Big Briefing is the latest News You Can Use with all of Martin's tips and tricks for making finances go further.

episodes.name: Mortgages
episodes.overview: The cash expert answers the financial questions that matter most, and offers tips and tricks for making finances go further. Alongside The Big Briefing is the latest News You Can Use.

episodes.name: Education
episodes.overview: The cash expert is on a mission to find out what children and young people know about cash, and with the continuing squeeze on family finances, what they really need to learn.

episodes.name: Going Green
episodes.overview: Martin answers the money questions that matter most to you. Alongside Martin's Big Briefing is the latest News You Can Use, with green tips and tricks marking COP26.

episodes.name: Savings
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis continues to tackle all the financial questions that matter most to you. There's also Martin's Big Briefing, and the latest News You Can Use.

episodes.name: 0% Borrowing
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis explains the best ways to borrow money interest-free, if a loan is necessary. He also addresses the Amazon Visa Credit news, as well as continuing to answer the financial questions that matter most to you.

episodes.name: Christmas Special?
episodes.overview: With winter looming, Martin Lewis helps you navigate the growing energy crisis to provide you with peace of mind.

episodes.name: Eenergy Re-Revisit
episodes.overview: In the last show of 2021 money maestro Martin Lewis shares his top tips on how to make your finances go further during the festive period. He shares tips on on maximising cash before Christmas so you're ready for a financially fit new year.

episodes.name: Xmas Trips and Tricks
episodes.overview: After a high-spending festive season for many, Martin kicks off the New Year with an update on the seismic energy bill crisis. Plus, the latest News You Can Use.

episodes.name: Energy & 2022 Need to Knows
episodes.overview: Martin continues his crusade to help you make your money go further, by busting the cost of your bills as we settle into the new year.

episodes.name: Bill Busters
episodes.overview: With millions of people missing out on benefits they are entitled to, Martin Lewis helps explain what everyone needs to know in this benefits special.

episodes.name: Benefits
episodes.overview: As the cost of living crisis escalates for many, Martin Lewis shares his annual debt cost cutting masterclass.

episodes.name: Debt
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis talks to Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak on the government's response to new energy price cap and interest rate increase.

episodes.name: Energy
episodes.overview: With the announcement of the new energy price cap, Martin Lewis tackles all your need-to-know energy questions, as well as answering your financial queries.

episodes.name: Pensions
episodes.overview: Martin calls in a panel of specialists to answer your questions about pensions. As well as tips on saving for retirement, he also launches his Pensions Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Student Finance
episodes.overview: As the government announces new student finance plans, Martin speaks to future university students about what the changes could mean for them if they attend university in 2023 or beyond. There's also the latest News You Can Use.

episodes.name: Cost of Living
episodes.overview: In this hour-long Cost of Living special, Martin Lewis shows how best to tackle the April price hikes, and shares tips on how to save cash by reducing the cost of household bills. Plus, in this final show of the series, Martin's on hand to answer your questions directly.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Martin is back - with staggering rises in household bills due for the winter of 2022-23, he has his must-knows to prepare for the months ahead, plus The Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: It's ten years since The Martin Lewis Money Show first hit our screens - to celebrate, Martin looks back at some of his biggest successes.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis continues to answer the money questions that matter most to you during this time of economic and political uncertainty and provide tips and tricks.

episodes.name: The Martin Lewis Money Show Live Special
episodes.overview: With Black Friday and Christmas 2022 on the horizon, Martin Lewis is tackling the big-spending festive season in this special from Battersea and Blackpool.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis is joined by a panel of experts addressing the financial subjects that matter most to you, including tax, benefits and the state pension.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: After a high spending festive season for many, Martin welcomes in the new year with more tips and suggestions, as well as answering questions and News You Can Use.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: As January continues - along with rises in bills and the cost of living - Martin Lewis is on hand to help the nation navigate cutting the cost of debt.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis continues his crusade to help steer us through the cost of living crisis by answering viewers' questions on savings rates.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis tackles the money matters hitting the headlines as we head into February and shares the best ways to make the most of our finances - he also reveals the latest deals and tips to help us save in his News You Can Use.

episodes.name: Housing Special
episodes.overview: Martin Lewis continues to help tackle the nation's finances with a housing special, and he'll be joined by a team of experts to help answer questions on the subject.

episodes.name: Pensions Special
episodes.overview: After a break for half term... Martin Lewis is back with a 90-minute Pension Special - he'll be joined by experts to answer your questions on private and state schemes, and he'll also be bringing you his latest News You Can Use and a chance to have your say in Your View.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview:
After a 1 week break for football Martin is back.

Martin is joined by Grant Shapps, the Secretary of State for Energy Security and Net Zero, to discuss how the latest energy policies could affect us.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: The nation's favourite money man tackles the cost of living crisis, giving savvy tips on how to make the most of your money if you're holidaying this summer - whether home or abroad - and much, much more.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: In this special programme, Martin is on hand with the latest analysis and finding out how the Chancellor's Spring Budget is likely to affect our personal finances.

episodes.name: Live: Liverpool
episodes.overview: To mark the final show in the present series, Martin is in Liverpool to answer our pressing questions and provide the latest money news in Martin's Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Energy
episodes.overview: With winter on its way, Martin Lewis is back to give his best tips and information, all the latest energy news, and advice on getting the most out of our cash.

episodes.name: Car and Home Insurance
episodes.overview: With home and car insurance premiums rocketing, Martin is on hand to try to help tackle those rising prices - he also answers questions on the cost of living and gives the latest money headlines in his Big Briefing and News You Can Use features.

episodes.name: Christmas Special
episodes.overview: Martin is back for his annual Christmas special - with the big spending season almost upon us, he shares tips on how to celebrate without breaking the budget.

episodes.name: Difficult Conversations
episodes.overview: Martin tackles the three sides of difficult conversations - death, divorce and dementia - in the latest edition of his show providing up-to-date financial news.

episodes.name: Top Savings Accounts
episodes.overview: Tune in for Martin's latest financial tips and tricks - you won't want to miss his Big Briefing and his always enlightening News You Can Use.

episodes.name: Reclaiming
episodes.overview: As we head into Christmas 2023 and finances tighten further, Martin's big topic is reclaiming as he shares tips on how to get cash back into our bank accounts.

episodes.name: Ask Martin Anything
episodes.overview: Tune in for the last of Martin's 2023 shows as he finishes the year off with his Christmas round-up, his informative Big Briefing, and his News You Can Use packed with thrifty deals.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Martin is back after the high-spending festive season to help us navigate our finances with the latest money-saving advice and information on the latest deals.

episodes.name: Bill Busting
episodes.overview: Martin is back with his 2024 Bill Busting episode - from mobiles to council tax and water to broadband, Martin's got it covered so we can get our outgoings in order.

episodes.name: Housing
episodes.overview: Martin's Big Briefing is packed with information on mortgages, renting, house prices and interest rates as he is joined by a team of specialists to answer your queries.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Martin tackles the topic of credit scoring and credit cards as his Big Briefing breaks down credit files, balance transfers and eligibility, plus hot new savings tips.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Martin covers Attendance Allowance and the FCA's major investigation into hidden car finance commissions that could affect millions in his Big Briefing this time

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: Martin's hitting the road again, and this time he's heading to Newcastle to answer your questions and unpack the week's biggest money matters in his Big Briefing.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Following the cut in winter fuel payments for many pensioners and October's Energy Price Cap rise, the money-saving expert focuses on the latest energy news and how the general public could be affected as well as sharing his tips and tricks for saving money at this crucial time.
